theory_name: Young's Cognitive Mapping with Semantic Networks

theory_metadata.theoretical_tradition: Cognitive mapping, political psychology, foreign policy analysis
theory_metadata.original_purpose: Enhance cognitive mapping through semantic network representations with differentiated relationships and truth values

telos.primary_purpose: Map decision-makers' cognitive belief structures through semantic networks to understand reasoning patterns and predict policy choices
secondary_purposes: Enable process model simulation of decision-maker reasoning
Support comparative analysis of different leaders' worldviews
Facilitate predictive modeling of policy responses
Provide structured representation for belief system analysis
telos.theoretical_scope: Individual-level cognitive structures in political decision-making contexts
telos.domain_applicability: Political speeches, policy statements, interviews, memoirs containing substantive belief expressions

classification.tier_justification: Explains decision-making through cognitive structure analysis and enables prediction through process modeling

concepts.definition: Substantive ideas, actors, objects, or abstractions in decision-maker's cognitive space
concepts.measurement: Frequency of mention weighted by contextual emphasis

relationships.definition: Directed connections between concepts with specified properties

conjunctions.definition: Logical connectors linking multiple concepts or relationships
conjunctions.function: Handle compound statements and complex logical structures

descriptive_relationships.is_a: A is a type of B

strategic_relationships.strategy: A uses means B to achieve end C

step_1_applicability_assessment.description: Evaluate text suitability for cognitive mapping analysis

criteria.concept_density: Rich substantive concepts for semantic nodes
criteria.belief_structure_relevance: Expressions of cognitive beliefs rather than event descriptions

step_2_concept_extraction.description: Identify all substantive concepts in the text
process: Extract noun phrases representing actors, objects, ideas, policies
Calculate salience through frequency and contextual emphasis
Categorize by concept type (actors, policies, abstract concepts, etc.)
Create comprehensive concept inventory with properties

step_3_relationship_identification.description: Extract directed relationships between concepts using Young's taxonomy
process: Identify explicit causal, strategic, descriptive relationships

step_4_conjunction_analysis.description: Identify logical connectors handling complex statements
step_4_conjunction_analysis.process: Extract compound relationships and represent using conjunction nodes

measures.dependency: Hierarchical organization based on bridging concepts

components: Analyze dominant relationship types and their implications
Assess agency beliefs and temporal dynamics

step_2_worldview_characterization.description: Generate substantive interpretation of cognitive map

step_3_process_model_preparation.description: Format results for directed-walk reasoning simulation
step_3_process_model_preparation.purpose: Enable computational reasoning simulation using belief network

step_4_comparative_analysis_setup.description: Structure results for cross-leader or temporal comparison

internal_consistency.relationship_coherence: All relationships use valid taxonomy categories
internal_consistency.truth_value_logic: Consistent application of truth values across similar statements
internal_consistency.temporal_consistency: Appropriate temporal modifiers for statement context
internal_consistency.salience_validity: Salience scores reflect actual textual emphasis

methodological_fidelity.compound_statement_handling: Appropriate use of conjunctions for complex statements

comparative_validation.temporal_stability: Reliable measurement of belief evolution over time
comparative_validation.inter_leader_comparison: Valid basis for comparative cognitive analysis
